intro: Chitonia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in the coastal waters of Mexico. It belongs to the family Aeolidiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body and vibrant coloration. The plant, though marine, is often mistaken for a plant due to its plant-like appearance and sessile lifestyle. It lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a muscular foot for attachment and a radula for feeding on algae. Chitonia mexicana plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various marine organisms.
